title: A New Site for Zaun has Appeared!

embed.description: Piltover is a thriving, progressive city whose power and influence is on the rise. It is Valoran's cultural center, where art, craftsmanship, trade and innovation walk hand in hand.

body:
Behold! Zaun!

With it we have a short story: "City of Iron and Glass", and the bios for Janna, Zac and Ekko!

replies.body: Hope you guys enjoy the stories. Please keep giving us feedback on how we can improve not only on the story-telling side, but also on how we deliver them (site layout, how we display stories, the cadence of delivery, etc), as this year we aim to deliver a lot for you and want to keep improving on how we do it.

I love how you release the champion stories in small numbers so people can genuinely enjoy them all instead of just flocking to ONE story and only that one being discussed.

*cough* Viktor being saved for last probably *cough*

Yeah, we tried several different ways as you might remember, but releasing them in small batches seems to be the preferred way. Is there anything else we can improve on? Is it easy to read/find the stories? How do you know when they come out? Is it the 'Sharjo effect'? Is there a better way for you to engage around these things?

To be frank if you're a lorehound like most of us here you easily just dive into the stories as soon as they get released but it's true that most players are just reminded of the existence of Lore by Sharjo or other outlets like Reddit.

I feel, a little popup in the client could be really cool, one that you can simply disable if you're not a fan of lore.
The layout is great and you can easily find the good stuff, notifying fans is the only thing that might be implemented.

Just my personal opinion though^^
That's great feedback, thanks!

If you don't mind, why was Twitch excluded from the event? Singed, the other Zaun champ thats missing from the site kinda got new lore anyways by the Warwick teasers so I give him a pass. I've been looking forward to a Twitch specific story for a while so I'm a little sad he's missing from the site.

With all these lore events we do there is always a chance that we will leave out a champion or two either because we want to flesh them out more or because we are happy with where they currently are or even because they are just too many from a faction that we simply can't tackle all at once. This is what happened during the Bilgewater event, same as The Shadow Isles event in 2015, and Piltover and Zaun now. We will eventually get to all of them, but we see these events as opportunities for us to tell the right stories at the right time rather than just rushing them for the sake of the event. As a fan of both Twitch and Singed (Zaun and Shadow Isles are my favorite regions, btw) I understand this doesn't feel great, but I assure you they will get updated at some point soon (tm).

This may seem like an odd request, but in the case of we as a community knowing that an event is coming for whatever reason, could you guys pop down here or on reddit to just alert us to any specifics like Twitch and Singed here? Just so we get the laydown of what the situation is and what we can expect. Even just saying "Hey guys, before you go in to all of this just know that X, Y and Z won't be getting lore updates this time around, would probably be enough.

I just want to say thanks for replying to both of my comments, a small voice in the masses. I know every question I throw at Riot can't always be seen or answered by those who can do something about it. 

Also, while I love the LoL lore and the universe site, I think pushing this content in the client more would help more people that are interested in seeing it. Malicious Metal's idea sounds pretty cool tbh
Hey thank **you** for taking the time to read the stories and provide us feedback here on the forums.

It is definitely not easy to find if you're just new to the game and want to know about characters.
I also often meet people in game who know very little about the lore. Maybe a lot of them just don't care, but some of them seem interested.

More of those quick tips in the loading screen, maybe? That could be used to deliver short lore trivia. Or give more hilariously useless tips XD
Ah that's great feedback. How do you usually find these new stories? Do you see the communication in the client? Boards? Reddit? Other sites (S@20)?
I just watch the boards and red posts for anything Sharjo related. That usually does the trick.
Same. Sharjo is the best source of League lore.
I propose we tie Sharjo to a machine, linking him to the internet. Every time there's new lore, he gets a shock that compels him to make a new thread.

Also I absolutely love the random lore in the loading screens.  Maybe after a thing is said it could say something like "see Leagueoflegends/universe.com for more lore.   Use the appropriate website address of course.  This way you advertise the existence of where to find lore if they want to look for it.

For the record I only know when they come out when folks like Moobeat tweet about it, and he knows because he has a tool to see updates on League's sites or something to that effect. 

Having this stuff linked on twitter, facebook, the client, all of it is helpful, though I do recommend you get working on a link to Universe and all this lore in the client itself as soon as you can!
I definitely like how you can just scroll down from Piltover down to Zaun. Wish the image was fully connected, though.

> [{quoted}](name=LeaoC,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=tzKKtsnF,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-01-12T19:24:12.697+0000)
>
> Hope you guys enjoy the stories. Please keep giving us feedback on how we can improve not only on the story-telling side, but also on how we deliver them (site layout, how we display stories, the cadence of delivery, etc), as this year we aim to deliver a lot for you and want to keep improving on how we do it.

I think your delivery is great - however,  there are some things that you could work on. For instance, I didn't know that Cassiopeia had a lore piece added until I was debating vigilantism the other day and they called her a Noxian vigilante and linked it. While I won't go into how diametrically opposing it is for a woman who tried to murder her scout to get to a priceless artifact and who once was a puppet master of Noxian aristocracy is now patrolling the streets saving innocents, it would have been nice to be notified of this addition. Perhaps an announcement bubble like you do for the known errors and bugs, except specifically for newly added lore pages and bios, or even some sort of in-client scrolling ticker for lore additions.

That does lead me to something I'm a bit upset about with the new lore. That would be Zac. Zac has *always* been this upbeat happy character from Zaun, which actually gives him and the city some personality as not being a city that's totally consumed by death, drudgery, and malaise. In your story, you've pushed him away from being an upbeat character, and by killing his parents, you've turned him into this slimy edgelord Batman of Zaun, and that kinda ruins him pretty hard. Could you perhaps rewrite this story so as to preserve his happy go lucky attitude (i.e. not kill everyone he loves), and to give us more diversity in your character development? It's getting a tad old that every single champion is starting to be founded on tragedy and vengeance.
I'm not seeing the edgelord part. His parents died, but he's not brooding around all the time because of it.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=tzKKtsnF,comment-id=000300030000,timestamp=2017-01-12T20:20:36.530+0000)
>
> I'm not seeing the edgelord part. His parents died, but he's not brooding around all the time because of it.

He's living in the pipework of the city and only pops out on occasion. This is pretty brooding to me, and it also detracts from his humanity that he developed while he was living with his parents.
He lived in cracks when living with his parents. Since his home was destroyed I doubt he has much better place to go. Plus he gets more emotions there.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=tzKKtsnF,comment-id=00030003000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-12T20:26:21.565+0000)

He did, but he also lived with them and grew up with them as sort of a Pinnochio type character. Him being raised and loved by humans is what defines Zac and makes him so lovable and endearing. Having his parents killed and him being a sewer recluse to soak in the emotions of humanity is just bleh and completely ruins him as a character.
~~He has no edges because he's well rounded~~

Ekko was just the saddest thing ever. I love the new direction being taken with Janna, I never found her to be compelling before but she has an interesting tie to Zaun that fits in the lore now. And Zac is also far more interesting than before. Can't wait to see Mundo and my Main girl! Jinx was just a blank slate, I can't wait to see her with a filled out backtory.

Have to say, i'm kind-of disappointed that Janna isn't even a human anymore but an actual alternative to an Elf -  A Spirit? 

What?

Seems like something **very** weak, especially since she has no power at all without someone crying for help.

I like that they kept her as a Guardian but i dislike her not being a Human at all. Unless she used to be.

Apparently, there will be no interactions whatsoever with her, she's a weak spirit with no ability to influence anyone outside of Zaun's docks apparently meaning she's useless to the lore. Good job, Riot! Completely deleted practically. You turned a Supporty Support into a full on Support spirit. A "caretaker" from some random magic or something which makes no sense at all right after you come up with that fucking Fairy Moon skin for her. Ofcourse!

PS:Don't forget to turn Soraka into the same thing then. But since you actually bothered to give Aurelion a line for her she has to be some Cosmic spirit then. Except that she actually can interact with the rest of the League unlike Janna for what you did to her.

TL;DR - Janna may aswell be deleted from the lore.

(Oh look, downvotes. The trolls are still active i guess seeing as there's no reply.)

So? Ivern won't do jack in the lore. Kled looks like he'll have no impact whatsoever. Don't get me started on guys like orianna. (I love her, but what's she gonna do, chuck her ball at the void?) Certain characters can't play as big of a role, and even Ryze has questionable impact on the lore. Janna was never really good for storytelling, so we're not losing anything. She just seems more interesting to me, in all honesty.

Ivern and Kled are shit characters in terms of lore interaction in general, but make up for it since they're nothing but goofy entertainment characters that are new as hell. Besides, i'm pretty sure Ivern and Kled could have interaction if a story steered in their direction like the Kumungu jungle or ancient Noxian ruins.

Orianna can be used for literally any event. If you didn't know better, you'd say MF won't have an impact ever since she's just a walking pair of boobs with guns but she did and even against The Harrowing when literally a touch from a single wraith could burn and kill you.

Ryze? Ryze can have stories interacting with any champion as long as it won't be a grand scale event since he's on a solo-quest so i doubt he'd get tangled in some war between Demacia and Noxus. He may meet Poppy for example who is also someone heavily determined to find something and she'd find interest in Ryze because "She has to find the Hero" and Ryze seems pretty cool.

Janna doesn't have any storytelling at all now. It's just an idealized way of saying "She barely exists now. Goodnight."

I know that MF is more than just a walking pair of milk ducts. She's a cold calculating bounty hunter who genuinely cares about her crew. Orianna (one of my favorite characters) never really seemed like she had much potential for the overall story, but maybe you see it differently. I just feel that with such a big cast that continues to expand, not everyone is gonna play a big role. And while Ryze will definitely play a role in the grand scheme of things, I just don't see him having much impact on the nations themselves. Riot has said themselves that he lives apart from humans and doesn't go to their cities.

Not everyone is gonna play a big role, that's not what i'm asking but at least give them some potential for it, e.g make them somehow important to the lore rather than have them play a big part in it for them to be relevant. Like Bard for example, he's hard to implement into the lore but his bio itself is enough to make him special and important to the Universe of Runeterra.

Well i am always imagining some Cinematic with champions when i talk about involvement of champions within lore but that's beyond the point lol.

To tell a good story  you don't have to fight battles on a grand scale. The problem with Janna is, even if they made a story **excusively** focusing on her (If that isn't her bio) then it would be nothing but what she does on her free time and some occasions where she helps people. We wouldn't have character development, emotional attachment or any interest in her because she's as simple as a Support can be. She shields people from harm and that's pretty much it. Nothing particularily exciting about that and it's so boring to read about the people she depends on "AKA, The fishermen" and THEIR problems rather than about Janna herself.

Just my thoughts.

But she's more interesting now. It used ot be that she was just some random wind mage from Zaun. Didn't fit the theme. But now she does, as she's seen as a holy figure by the people of Zaun, making her more unique in the long run.

NOW she is some random wind thing from Zaun. And personally i hate religion i general due to how stupid it is. She's a religious figure to Zaun's fishermen, she's not actually a religious being. Noone gives a fuck about her outside of her own new "lore".
